title: Olaf Scholz - Wikipedia
snippet: Olaf Scholz (born 14 June 1958) is a German politician who served as the Chancellor of Germany from 2021 to 2025. A member of the Social Democratic Party (SPD), he previously served as Vice Chancellor in the fourth Merkel cabinet and as Federal Minister of Finance from 2018 to 2021.

title: Olaf Scholz | Facts, Biography, Cabinet, & Chancellor of Germany | Britannica
snippet: Olaf Scholz served as chancellor of Germany from 2021 to 2025.

title: Olaf Scholz 2021 to 2025 | Federal Chancellor
snippet: Olaf Scholz (SPD) was elected ninth Federal Chancellor of the Federal Republic of Germany in December 2021. He led the first “traffic light coalition”, consisting of SPD, Bündnis 90/Die Grünen and FDP, at the federal level.

title: Olaf Scholz: The German chancellor on life support | Al Majalla
snippet: German Interior Minister Horst Seehofer, Finance Minister and Vice-Chancellor Olaf Scholz and German Chancellor Angela Merkel have taken their seats on the government's bench, on March 14, 2018 in Berlin

title: Germany's Scholz set to run for second term after potential rival bows out | Reuters
snippet: Clears way for current Chancellor Scholz to run for second term ... BERLIN, Nov 21 (Reuters) - German Chancellor Olaf Scholz was set to run for a second term in upcoming snap elections after his popular Defence Minister Boris Pistorius - a possible ...
